comment.author: 29180804@N04
comment._content: I believe that is her husband, Harry Payne Whitney, standing behind her. He had a distinctive deep ridge in his right cheek. www.newyorksocialdiary.com/socialdiary/2006/08_09_06/imag...

comment.author: 29180804@N04
comment._content: Also, if the date of the photo is truly June 9th, then I believe that the photo was taken at Belmont Park. Joe Notter was a regular rider for the Whitneys' trainer, James G. Rowe, Sr, but I can't find another photograph that would confirm whether or not he is the jockey in this photo.

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Helen Julia Hay Whitney (1876 - September 24, 1944) was an American poet, writer, racehorse owner/breeder, socialite, and philanthropist. She was a member by marriage of the prominent Whitney family of New York. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Helen_Hay_Whitney

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: Richard Arthur Norton: Thanks for Whitney's full name. We'll add it to the description next time we update.

comment.author: 74471476@N08
comment._content: Daughter of Secretary of State John Hay.
